name: Nine Days Gone
body: Frontman Joseph Keith, bass guitarist Eric Daniel, and drummer Luke P formed Nine Days Gone in 2009 The band writes and records all original material in the Washington DC area. The bands influences come from a variety of alternative/punk bands like Green Day, Sum 41, and Blink 182. Nine Days Gone started playing shows in the Fall of 2011, and since then they have gained popularity across the DC metro area. They have been privileged enough to be featured on multiple radio stations, open for major local acts, and work with renowned producer John Piette to record their second album "As It's Always Been".

name: BLUEfiveone
body: You may recognize BLUEfiveone as the original drummer from The Five One. Following a separation from the band, BLUEfiveone couldn't see himself quitting music, and he hasn't. Instead, he has teamed up with a group of talented musicians, forming, "BLUEfiveone and BLUE County" Together they deliver lyrics that share personal truths and songs that share emotion with you in a way that is so familiar, it's as if they were written and catered for you. The sounds they meld together are the feelings and sensations you have, and never thought could be translated into a musical medium. BLUEfiveone offers nothing more than a vision of COLOR, and that COLOR is BLUE.

name: Rogue Mind
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

7:00 - Doors
8:00 - All The Gods
9:00 - The Influence
10:00 - Rogue Mind



Hailing from the suburbs of the Washington, DC metropolitan area, Rogue Mind have only just begun to redefine the tried and true power trio formula. After continually playing the songs that everyone thinks they want to hear, these three intrepid souls wanted to undertake a fresh project to serve as counterpoint to a music industry that is increasingly focused on formula, image and hype. Having the old familiar faces of friends to draw creativity, perspective and strength from in their new endeavor, Rogue Mind seamlessly blends elements of indie rock, alternative and metal into a distinct, yet familiar format that is equally interesting and accessible to the modern rock listener.

 

 

With nearly 200 self-booked tour dates played annually for the past four years, The Influence takes the DIY ethic to the next level. They have amassed a solid fanbase up and down the Eastern seaboard with their electric live show featuring explosive choruses, multi-layered harmonies, and tag-team drum interludes. To date The Influence has supported such artists as Paramore, Papa Roach, Shiny Toy Guns and Jimmy Eat World to name a few.

The Influence official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes

 

 

All The Gods is a veteran newcomer to the mid-Atlantic music scene. In the late 1990s, members of All The Gods performed inspired high-energy shows from Leesburg to Boston. They spent most of the last decade writing, recording and learning new instruments. In early 2011, Gino Bona (vocals/bass), Eric Kielb (guitar), and Joe Milausnic (drums) reformed as a power trio. All The Gods' music boldly blends soaring melodies with progressive power rock fundamentals. The result is a band that's comfortable in its own skin and capable of shaking you from your own.

All The Gods official site | twitter | facebook

name: Banjo Man & Friends Family Show
body:
Frank Cassel is an award winning entertainer, musician and songwriter. He performs folk, bluegrass and original music for all audiences, including children. He has performed a popular Friday morning show at Jammin' Java in Vienna, VA for over 8 years.'

Frank Cassel and Friends includes: Chris Colvin (Mr. Chris), didgeridoo, mountain dulcimer; Shannon Bishop, Shapeshifter (hoop dancing) and Barney Thompson, guitar and harmonica

name: The Smithsonian + Jammin Java present Rocknoceros
body:
Zooglobble Recommended!: "Kudos to the great taste of the DC area. You already know what the rest of the country is starting to find out - that Rocknoceros is a gem of a band."

"An outstanding mix of folk and rock...literate songs...poppy approach...multi-generational appeal." - NPR, Best Music for Kids and Families

 


As every family with youngsters in the DC area already knows, Rocknoceros (pronounced like rhinoceros) is three guys: Coach Cotton, Williebob, and Boogie Woogie Bennie. After seeing them perform, there is no denying that they are not a typical trio. Coach Cotton is the ring-leader, frequently immersed in a sea of knee-high concert goers. Wearing a wireless head-set microphone, he wades through the mass of dancing children, dispersing high-fives and shaking a tambourine. Williebob provides the necessary string work for the show, moving among a collection of guitars, mandolins, and banjos while wearing a kazoo around his neck. Boogie Woogie Bennie is a one-man-band within the power trio, employing a contraption that one four-year-old fan described as "the piano-drum". The piano-drum allows Boogie Bennie to play the bass drum with his right foot, the snare drum and hi-hat cymbal with his left foot, and the keyboard with his hands (with his left hand playing the bass parts). Together, Rocknoceros is able to cover a dizzying range of musical styles in each set. From Tin Pan Alley to the shores of Jamaica, Rocknoceros hops from genre to genre like a toad on summer asphalt.

Having already released three award-winning records, the new album tells tales of the Colonel and his friends in their make-believe home of Soggy Bog. The theme of "Colonel Purple Turtle" is one of friendship and working together, a subject that matters to Coach, Boogie Woogie Bennie, and Williebob, as the three members of Rockncoeros have been best friends since they were children. The record reflects their abiding trust in each other, and their desire to share the message of camaraderie through song.

name: Find Vienna
body: Find Vienna is a band from Philadelphia, PA who has been riding on the success of their Debut EP "In Your Favorite Colors." Since the release of "In Your Favorite Colors" in Sept 09 the band has followed a packed tour schedule playing with bands such as The Script, Neon Trees, Parachute, Green River Ordinance, Mae, and Company of Thieves. Music from "In Your Favorite Colors" has also been placed in MTV and E! Network television shows, played on top 40 stations and on numerous online radio stations including Clear Channel's Iheart Radio. In January of 2011 Find Vienna re-entered the studio to begin writing and recording for their debut album. After a few months, the band realized that they didn't want to wait for a full-length. They wanted to release something sooner. As a result, Find Vienna decided to release a 5 track EP called "In Flight". The EP "In Flight" was released at Find Vienna's Hometown Holiday Show at The World Cafe Live on Dec 22nd and is now available at all online music retail outlets. Armed with a new EP and live show, Find Vienna is poised to hit the road and up the ante.

name: Rosie Thomas
body:
Early show! This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

The following is the schedule for the evening - all times subject to change without notice:


5:00 - The new Lobby Bar opens for dinner/drinks
6:00 - Doors
7:00 - Bhi Bhiman
7:30 - Rosie Thomas

 

 

Rosie Thomas official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

Rosie's debut album, 2001's When We Were Small, employed several friends from Cornish as studio musicians, and much of the cast from those sessions would return on the 2003 sophomore release, Only With Laughter Can You Win. If Songs Could Be Held came next in 2005, and was followed the subsequent year by Thomas' inclusion on the Paper Bag Records compilation See You on the Moon! to which she contributed the song "Faith's Silver Elephant."

Rosie's next project was a fresh return to the relaxed creative process that first drew her to entertaining through music. This meant a gathering of friends, collaborative creation, and, in the end, a sincere celebration of music and people called These Friends of Mine, issued in late 2006 through her own label, Sing-A-Long Records. The album includes the appearance of friends Sufjan Stevens, Damien Jurado, David Bazan (Pedro the Lion), and Denison Witmer. Thomas also released a 2008 Christmas album, A Very Rosie Christmas, through her label.

 

 

Bhi Bhiman official site | twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube

Bhi Bhiman's bellowing tenor can soothe or explode at a moment's notice. Bhi's mix of humor and deep empathy puts him in the company of distinguished (and much older) lifelong songsmiths like John Prine, Nick Lowe and Randy Newman. And Bhiman's technical, emotive guitar playing rises to the challenge that his striking voice presents. BHIMAN is Bhi's first truly great album, but one gets the impression that he'll be singing his stories for a very long time to come.

name: Digitour
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

The following is the schedule for the evening - all times subject to change without notice:

6:00 - The new Lobby Bar opens for dinner/drinks
6:15 - Door - VIP Meet & Greet
7:00 - Door - General Admission
8:00 - Digitour


 

The Digitour official site | twitter | facebook | youtube

"The Digitour," a large-scale music tour featuring some of the biggest self-made YouTube stars, is heading back on the road for Spring 2012! Last year's successful beginning broke new ground and made an indelible mark in the entertainment industry by changing the traditional concert platform and helped launch solid brands that have the ability to bridge the gap between web and the mainstream.

 

 

Dave Days official site | twitter |myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

Dave Days, 19, is the #1 rocker on YouTube. Ever since he picked up his first guitar he's been writing music and working his creative mind. His music and abilities were unheard of in the world until the internet came along. By internet, I mean YouTube. Dave began posting videos of his music and other skits and gained over 200,000 subscribers and over 50,000,000 views in his first year. Now topping 1.5 million subscribers, Dave is often referred to as an entertainer, musician, comedian, and sometimes even as Miley Cyrus' boyfriend [wink]. He has been spotted numerous times wearing a green polo and white hat and he was also the first YouTuber to sign on to play DigiTour 2011.

 

DeStorm twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube

DeStorm, a Baltimore City native, fell in love with entertainment at a very young age. With a passion for music and art, yet no professional training, he is both artistically gifted and extremely driven. DeStorm has over 1,000,000 subscribers and is currently the 12th ranked music channel on YouTube. "What's up World?"-DeStorm's catch phrase-can be heard at the start of every video. DeStorm often composes and performs covers of well known songs or creates content for major brands such as Pepsi, GE, Yahoo and Nintendo. Power also creates original content based upon subscribers' challenges and suggestions, like name dropping various movie titles. DeStormTV, DeStorm's second YouTube channel, is used primarily for blogging, motivational, and behind the scenes videos. As a former personal trainer and Olympic level triple jumper, he also gives fitness tips to the 200,000+ subscribers on this channel. DeStorm was one of the original DigiTour headliners performers in 2011.

 

 

Ricky Ficarelli official site | twitter |facebook | youtube

Ricky Ficarelli, 18, stumbled upon his dad's drum set at an early age and it was love at first sight. He could soon play any instrument he picked up, including guitar, bass and keyboards. He has played in numerous bands since he was 12. Since moving to Los Angeles in early 2011, Teen Magazines around the country, including Bop and Tiger Beat and many others, have noted Ricky as the Teen Star to watch, as did Hollywood tastemaker Ryan Seacrest. He has been featured in the new Blink 182! documentary and recently played drums on The Disney Channel's "So Random" alongside Dave Days. Ricky is also a road hardened DigiTour veteran. He was invited to be one of only five YouTube Stars to do all twenty-five cities on the monumental DigiTour 2011 live tour.

 


Alex Goot official site | twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube

Alex Goot is a young multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter based out of Poughkeepsie New York. In a few short years, Alex has become quite a force in independent music, rising to the top of both the YouTube and iTunes charts without the help of a label. Through his self-produced original, and cover material, Alex has managed to build a loyal organic fan base that is constantly eager for more. Recently Alex has embarked on a very successful first headlining tour, received an MTV O award for Best Fan Cover, and secured a spot in the coveted YouTube top 200. With a growing repertoire of both original and cover material, paired with a YouTube channel that's poised to grow faster than Bieber after that growth spurt, Alex is one of the artists to watch for in 2012.

 

Asher Monroe official site | twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube

Asher Monroe is a golden-throated vocal powerhouse whose dark-eyed charm and lushly romantic songs, like the epic single "Like I Do," only add to his appeal. Already known as a versatile performer in the worlds of theater (national tours with Beauty and The Beast and The Sound of Music), films (the 2009 re-make of the Oscar-winning Fame), television (Parenthood, The Mentalist), and music (as former lead vocalist for pop-R&B vocal group V Factory), Monroe is now forging a name for himself as a solo artist, and he's off to an impressive start. When the video for "Like I Do" hit YouTube in November, it created a fan frenzy, racking up more than 1.5 million views, half of them within the first 24 hours alone.In 2008, he joined V Factory, which scored a Top 40 single, opened for such artists as Kelly Clarkson, Flo Rida, and MC Hammer, and even headlined a show in The Philippines for 20,000 people. After V Factory, Monroe decided to pursue an opportunity for a movie that had arisen. He was cast as Marco in Fame, which hit theaters in September 2009. "Not only was it my first feature and my first lead, but I got to sing, so it was an amazing opportunity," Monroe says. After the film came roles on NBC's Parenthood and CBS's The Mentalist.

 

NicePeter  twitter |myspace | facebook | youtube

NicePeter is a self-described "Comic / Guitar Hero" specializing in original musical comedy via his popular YouTube channels (Nice Peter and Nice Peter Too). Peter's YouTube channels have over 300 million views and he is quickly approaching 1.75 million subscribers across 4 channels, making him one of the most popular and prominent personalities on the platform. Keeping everyone laughing with his two most popular series "Monday Vlog Show" and "Epic Rap Battles of History," Peter dedicates most of his time to producing only the best videos for his extremely supportive fans. When he's not making videos, Peter can usually be found wearing his signature yellow sunglasses and hanging out at Maker Studios, a collaborative media company in which he's proud to be a part of. Nice Peter and Epic Rap Battles of History have been featured in the Wall Street Journal and The Huffington Post, and Peter was

 

 

The Key of Awesome  twitter  facebook | youtube

The Key of Awesome is a Musical comedy show spoofing celebrities, pop-culture, pop music, and the latest internet memes. The Key of Awesome features original songs and song parodies written and performed by Mark Douglas, and his wife Anastasia Douglas. The Key of Awesome currently has over 600 million hits on youtube. Their parody of Ke$ha's Tik Tok was the number two video of 2010 and surpassed the original in views.

 


WhatADayDerek official site | twitter | youtube

WhatADayDerek started off on YouTube doing behind the sense stuff for the popular channel called The Station. Occasionally he will pop up in one of the videos. He has a weekly live show every Sunday and Wednesday at 8pm central. Check him out there at www.stickam.com/whatadayderek.

name: Unity: 311 Tribute
body: Unity is the premier 311 tribute band of the DC area, and after two blockbuster 311 day performances in 2011 and 2012, they are back at it again! This time, Unity will be rocking the stage at Jammin' Java for a Halfway-To-311-Day celebration on October 5, 2012!! Unity formed when members from two top local acts, Feed God Cabbage and Irresponsible, came together to pay tribute to 311, a band whose success and endurance in the rock world speaks volumes. The high-energy, hard rocking show that Unity brings every time they take the stage will leave you wondering if you had just seen the real 311!

name: Drew Holcomb and The Neighbors
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.


The following is the schedule for the evening - all times subject to change without notice:

7:00 - Doors
8:00 - Nathan Angelo
9:00 – Drew Holcomb and the Neighbors


 

Drew Holcomb official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

Holcomb and his band have found their own unique niche in with their 2008 LP, Passenger Seat, and their 2009 EP, Live Forever, both debuting at #2 on the iTunes Singer/Songwriter charts. They've also had multiple TV placements on shows like NBC's Parenthood, Oprah, Army Wives, The Cleaner, and others, proving that Holcomb's career has stretched far beyond the TN state limits where he was born and raised. Over the past half-decade Holcomb & the Neighbors have played over 1,000 tour dates and garnered a massive following.

When audiences hear Holcomb's songs, there is an emotional attachment and reaction, proven by the epic "Live Forever" which was recently used during an episode of NBC's Parenthood and sparked a downloading frenzy online. On Chasing Someday, Holcomb and his Neighbors have found a unique voice, one that definitely has the potential to add to the conversation in a profound and substantial way.

 

 

Nathan Angelo official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

With no plans of pursuing music professionally, Nathan stumbled into songwriting more as catharsis than ambition. What started as a hobby after college quickly turned into a passion, one which he soon felt necessary to share with an audience. Coupled with an incessant touring schedule and attention paid to the ever-changing landscape of social media, Nathan has managed to sell over 15,000 albums independently. He's also toured with national acts such as the Fray, Zac Brown Band, Marc Broussard and Matt Wertz. In 2009, Nathan caught the attention of a major publishing company, Warner/Chappell. Compelled by his ability to mix modern-pop with classic songwriting, Warner/Chappell signed Nathan to a publishing deal, a rare occasion for an independent artist, and has since been called upon to write for the likes of Kelly Clarkson & Justin Bieber.

A commercial spin on soul-infused pop, Nathan's latest project Follow Your Heart (2011) emerges as his strongest work to date. As much an album title as it is an anthem, Follow Your Heart displays Nathan's ear for melody and keen understanding of story and reveals that he has much in store for fans both new and old.

name: Mercury Rising + In Your Memory
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Mercury Rising  facebook

Mercury Rising is from Silver Spring, MD. Created in Cali and rockin with love of the DMV on its back. From the demise of a few old bands and the collaboration of melodic and chaotic styles Mercury Rising is able to woo listeners with our slower tunes and get you dancing all in the same motion. Making an immediate name for ourselves in the Local Hip Hop scene has been a big goal for the band due to how and where we grow up. And Working with platinum selling pop stars and modifying the direction of the music from the tutelage of Mars Volta's Omar Rodriguez-Lopez and Cedric Bixler-Zavala we have been able to gain the greatest knowledge that we could have acquired, which simply were the words "Keep it Real", -Omar

While the rock scene in DC remains faithful to itself, Mercury Rising is bringing back the independence that once was REAL ROCK AND ROLL. With the diversity of the band and cultural attributes from members representing Panama, Colombia, El Salvador, and Mexico Mercury Rising ads in latin flavor, as well as R&B influence into each set we play.

 

 

In Your Memory  twitter |  facebook

name: Bloodlines
body:
Late show! This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Bloodlines is a original hard rock local area band that has been playing for 6 years, With original favorites such as Asphalt Tattoo, and hard rock covers.

 

 

OVERDRIVE SUPERTHRUSTER (ODST) is a Virginia based group playing a unique brand of heavy pop rock originals. Songs are massive combining heavy guitars, shot-gun drums, extraordinary bass lines, endless harmonies, and unforgettable hooks. Influences are varied (Stones, JET, Foo, Queen, QOTSA, Zeppelin, Beatles) but not overt or overdone as each song is performed via the musical talents of four very different rock and roll souls - from a Berklee trained bass player and trumpet-trained lead guitar player, to a self-taught country picker and a drummer from a marching band. This rare mix of rock'n'rolla's produces powerful tracks that give listeners' multiple influences in every song. The band's first studio album, Stay Gold Sessions (available @ iTunes and CD Baby), was a stripped down, self-produced affair recorded live in early 2007 in an attempt to capture the band's raw energy and pop hooks. Stay Gold Sessions was followed up by multiple live performances including the 2008 and 2009 Shamrock Festivals in Washington DC (DC area's biggest St. Patrick's Day Festival). After more live performances in the summer of 2009, the boys put touring on hold to record their second album. The new record, Raven Nevermore, is out now (CDBABY.com) and features 11 critically acclaimed original rock and roll tracks.

Overdrive Superthruster myspace | facebook

name: The Smithsonian + Jammin Java present Shine & the Moonbeams
body:
"There was something in the performance touched folks emotionally." Out with the Kids raved that Shine and the Moonbeams' songs were "heartfelt, insightful and emotional, with brilliant musicianship to boot." - Zooglobble

 

Shine and the Moonbeams are singer -songwriter Shawana Kemp and guitarist John Heagle, two New York musicians who have collectively been in every musical genre from Musical Theatre to the circus. They have combined their unique perspectives to create a soulful musical extravaganza that captures the sweetness, uncertainty and simplicity of youth. John currently plays with the faux French garage-rockers Les Sans Culottes. Shawana works in NYC public schools as a teaching artist and is the mother of a three year old.

name: The Smithsonian + Jammin Java present Tim and the Space Cadets
body:
Tim Kubart created Tim and the Space Cadets in 2009 after four years as a professional kids' musician, and set out to make radio-friendly pop rock for all ages. He's played with various children's music projects in classrooms and at street fairs, music festivals like Austin City Limits and Lollapalooza, and venues like Sesame Place and the Intrepid Museum, one of New York City's largest concert spaces.

Tim and his first mate Matt Puckett (guitar, backup vocals) put their heads together to write songs that exist somewhere in the realm between Raffi and Blink-182, inspired by memories of school days, snow days, pizza parties, and summer vacations. "The Greatest Party Ever" weaves their witty, fun, and heartwarming lyrics through textured pop tunes, rockers, and lullabies.

Let "The Greatest Party Ever" begin!

name: Joseph Guerra
body:
Joseph is a young, up and coming rapper out of Reston, Virginia. Spending every moment he can writing music, he has become devoted to his artistic craft. He has dropped one mixtape, and that has propelled his name into the mouths of the people of Northern Virginia. At just 17 years old, he has truly seperated himself from other artists in the game with his ability to articulate his flow. Look for him to make some major noise in the upcoming year!

Joseph Guerra  facebook |  youtube

name: 3MTs
body: The 3MTs began as 3 music teachers in Fairfax County who all had a passion for playing and writing music. We first got together in January 2011 to begin playing covers for fun, and then each of us brought original songs to the group. After only 4 rehearsals, we had our first show lined up playing for a luncheon at Jack's church, and there began our journey. Since then we've continued to play multiple venues, selling out Jammin Java in January 2012! We each bring diverse original songs to the band and are currently working on songwriting together to create a more cohesive sound within the group. Acoustic guitars, bass, keyboard, and mandolin are just a few of the instruments used during our performances, which are combined with vocals from all three members. We are so excited to continue our musical journey together!

name: Caspar Babypants
body:
Chris Ballew is one rockin' dad. As the lead singer and guitarist of The Presidents of the United States of America, Chris Ballew is used to rocking out in front of millions of fans. Today, Chris is rockin' to a younger set as Caspar Babypants. Ballew's first brush with children's music came in 2002 when he recorded and donated an album of traditional children's songs to the nonprofit Program for Early Parent Support titled "PEPS Sing A Long!" Ballew began digging up nursery rhymes and folk songs in the public domain, songs that have been reinterpreted and passed down through generations. This, in addition to a number of original songs, formed his first full-length release, "Here I Am!"

The album was a hit locally, and Ballew began to perform in the Seattle area. A longtime friend, Fred Northup, heard the album while working on a project with Ballew, and Northup offered to play as his live percussionist. Northup, a Seattle-based comedy improvisor, suggested his frequent collaborator Ron Hippe as a keyboard player, and Ballew subsequently auditioned Hippe. Christening the two "Frederick Babyshirt" and "Ronald Babyshoes", they officially became the Caspar Babypants live band in 2009.

name: Aaron Crawford and The Badcards
body:
When you listen to Aaron Crawford you're instantly struck; by his sound - part So Cal punk, part rockabilly, part rootsy troubadour, by his songwriting - honest, open and relatable, and by his obvious fearlessness to stand up for what he believes in, no matter what the cost. His desire for truth shows in the musical messages Crawford delivers in his songs. Not one to walk away from something he's passionate about, it motivates him to hold the bar high for himself. A bold performer, who fronted punk scenesters Rude Buddha, he stops at nothing to achieve his goal. "I'm inspired by any story, or person who has had to fight to get what they have, and lives with no regrets."

In February 2011, Aaron entered Hollywood Sound Recorders, a Los Angeles based studio with Producer/Percussionist Larry Ciancia, who's studio and performance credits include artists like Ben Taylor, Fiona Apple, Everlast, Ray LaMontagne, Carly Simon and Herbie Hancock. Ciancia's first task was getting a band around Aaron to compliment his diverse writing style. In doing so he enlisted the help of guitarist Joel Shearer (Alanis Morrisette, Pedestrian, Dido) to engineer and perform on the record as well as keyboardist Adam Macdougall (The Black Crowes, Macy Gray) to fill out the recordings, giving them a vintage rock sound full of life, character, and soul. Ken Barnum, D.C. punk bassist, engineer and good friend of Aaron's was also brought on to fill out this incredible studio band. During a short pre-production period, Ciancia had Aaron co-write with a few different writers including '09 Grammy winner Joshua Lopez on a song called "Next to You", an energetic "Clash" style number that Aaron fell in love with the moment he heard it. Then the group hit the studio. The recording sessions, described by Aaron as "magical and memorable" proved amazing, cranking out 5 completed songs in 4 days of tracking! Shortly after, Shawn Everett was brought on to mix. Shawn, best known for his work with Weezer, Jakob Dylan and Pete Yorn, brought out the best in the recordings, which can be heard throughout the LA sessions. "Bad Habit" which has enough back to be appreciated by even the most hardcore rapper, is a song of revelation and realization, discussing the age old topic; "Is it the sex or the person?" The track slams throughout, moving from hip danceable verses, to huge pop choruses, while "Don't Stop" and "Let Go" show the honesty, and relate ability of a good song, discussing topics of believing in someone, and moving on. Of the newly recorded numbers, "Breathe" is the most intimate, explaining that music is Aaron's home, and through music he is never without shelter. Adam MacDougall's performance on the grand piano in "Breathe", turns this song into a beautiful ballad reminiscent of early Elton John that will take your breath away.

Aaron then headed home and combined these recordings, with recordings from late 2010, which includes the songs, "Sick Sick Love", a grungy brit-rock banger discussing the topic of using sex as a weapon to elevate, and rise above drama, "Black White Radio", which asks the question "should I waste my time on MTV"? And Locket, a mysterious Latin influenced punk song about a key and lock Aaron wears around his heart to complete the yet to be released album, "The Wager". Brian Lucey, who received a Grammy for his work with The Black Keys in 2011, was brought on to master and complete the record. Bratty at times, honest and direct at others, "The Wager" truly encompasses Aaron's wont back down spirit and showcases his ability with maturity and swagger. Song writing is Aaron's base, on some tracks beautiful and gentle, on others combative and belligerent, but never hiding behind a mixed message. With Aaron Crawford, what you hear is what you get.

body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

name: Atrium
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Atrium is an alternative rock group based in Northern Virginia. Fully formed in mid 2011, Atrium is the result of the combination of two former local bands. The band consists of bassist and vocalist Emily Allen, guitarist and vocalist Paul Ward, guitarist Chris Suter, and drummer Taylor Stalfort. Working with producer David Pavluk, the band recently finished recording their debut EP, Post Script. The album marks a transitional point with the band, both with their personal growth and in their music. Self described as "Xtremo," Post Script fuses dark, distorted instrumentals with bright melodies and meaningful lyrics to create an EP that really resonates with listeners. Gaining in support, Atrium is a progressive rock band that's proving it has something to say with a powerful sound to accompany.

 

 

Panic Manor official site | facebook

 

Us & Them  twitter |  facebook

name: Jake Barkley
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Jake Barkley only seventeen years old, and he's already on the heels of his career. With a mix of Hip-Hop and Electro, the only way to describe Jake Barkley is "New Breed".

 

 

Started by lead vocalist/songwriter/producer Rolan Mayo in the summer of 2008 as a solo project, now "Kalliko" is a unique band that's trying to be a household name. After putting music online for a year, Rolan ran into Chris Barrett, ex-drummer of boy band "The Friday Night Boys" on Twitter late 2010. Chris liked his work, so he quickly took him under his wing. Going on the road, doing shows with mostly Chris and other artists, also meeting many mainstream artists, Kalliko has came a very long way since before he met Chris. He has a unique sound, something a lot of people aren't use to, but they love the sound. Kalliko released his first major EP "About A Girl EP", January 5th, 2012.

Kalliko official site | twitter | facebook | youtube

name: Call For Fire
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Taking the immense musical creativity of the 70's and pairing it with smashing alternative riffs, Call for Fire brings back the genuine hard rock sound while also drawing from inventive melodies to provide listeners an original experience.

 

 

The Tattooed Beach Sluts (TBS) are a Vienna based band that plays a range of Classic Rock to Modern Pop (as long as it sounds good!) They have their influences from Queen and the Beatles, but they play their own stuff too! They feature 4 guys who just want to play some tunes, and play the best music they can.

TBS  facebook

 

 

My friends really do call me Piano. I'm half Italian and in Italy "piano" means quiet, which is kind of funny because I'm anything but quiet. In Italian the instrument "piano" is "pianoforte" which means "quiet and loud" and that describes me better.

They Call Me Piano official site | facebook |twitter | youtube

 


Jammin' Java proudly presents Australian singer songwriter, Rick Caballo. Rick blends southern rock, country and international flavor into his phenomenal original music. Rick's first album, Love Retaliation, shows the talent and creative depth of his writing. A Grand Finalist in the coveted Toyota Star Maker contest in Tamworth, Australia's No.1 Country Music Festival in 2010, Rick has been recording a new album with legendary Nashville musicians and producers and touring the US, Europe and Australia. Rick has made Nashville his home away from the Land Down Under. Always a rockin' show - you won't want to miss Rick Caballo's debut at Jammin' Java!

Rick Caballo official site |  myspace | facebook | youtube

name: Melissa Ferrick
body:
This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.


Melissa Ferrick has a great deal to show for two decades in the music industry. There is the expansive body of work, mapped out over the sixteen albums that comprise her career to date, nearly all of which she distributed herself. There is the fervent fan-base that has grown with Ferrick, which has waited patiently for her latest opus for the preceding three years.

Still Right Here is folk-rock powerhouse Melissa Ferrick's first studio album in five years, combining the lyrical sophistication of Aimee Mann with the driving acoustic guitar of Dave Matthews. Featuring performances by Ani DiFranco and Kaki King, the album perfectly showcases Ferrick's finely-honed chops as a singer and guitarist, while highlighting her prowess on several other instruments including piano and drums. Co-produced by Ferrick with Brooklyn indie darling Alex Wong (The Paper Raincoat, Vienna Teng) and Thomas Eaton (Ellis Paul, Vance Gilbert), this is a sonically rich, emotionally intense album that will appeal to fans of Tegan & Sara, Ben Harper, She & Him, Jakob Dylan, Tristan Prettyman and David Gray. Ferrick decided to sign to MPress Records after years of self-distributing her albums, which at first proved a difficult to decision to make. Above all there is the sound, a voice burnished by breakdowns and breakthroughs, refined over the twenty years she has been doing this.

name: Castle of Genre
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Castle of Genre is an indie rock band based out of northern Virginia, consisting of 5 members. Despite their relatively young age, they bring a mature, well-crafted sound to the table that harkens back to a late 90's underground emo sound with walls of glistening tones, uninhibited by the usual overdriven tendencies of rock music. They may be young, but there's a spark of brilliance in their work that makes these kids worth paying close attention to.

 

 

Howlin Bends' sound pays homage to the artists who created and perfected the rock and roll genre. A Howlin Bends' musical arrangements are in direct relation with those of Cream, The Who, and Led Zeppelin. As a guitarist, lyricist, and primary songwriter for the band, M.J. McLaughlin's message is a passionate one of fear, change, love, and experience. Witness something revolutionary. Become aware of emotions you have never felt before. Have renewed faith and respect for contemporary music. Support a cause that exists only to please and entertain you.

The Howlin Bends official site | twitter |  facebook

 

 

Nor Cator & The Ooh La La's is a rock & roll band consisting of Ryan Morris and Dutch Nethercutt, two creative young men residing in the back woods of Manassas, Virginia. Their punk drive presents energy to get the crowd moving and exhilarated. Now roaming the DC/Metropolitan area, Nor Cator fills the region with good, good vibrations.

Nor Cator & The Ooh La La's official site |  facebook

 

 

Amanda Badzé is a singer, songwriter, and actress. Born in the beautiful Gweru, Zimbabwe; Harare is her hometown.As music was not particularly emphasized in her household, she relied heavily on her own unique understanding of what music ought to be. This was the birth of her creative approach towards music, lyrics, rhythm, and expression. Her truly unique and colorful personality is implemented, and emulated, within her music. She is unwavering in the surety of her calling to continue on in her unparalleled passion for music, art, and expression. She's found that her music and soul are one in the same, and there is no better place than the stage, to see them both at their finest.

Amanda Badzé official site | twitter |  facebook | itunes | youtube

name: Freedy Johnston
body:
This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

 

Johnston's songs are often praised for their literary quality - and deservedly so - but they also hit you on a gut level. As a young man, Johnston was drawn to both the raw energy of punk and the austere beauty of Paul McCartney's vocal melodies.When it came out in 1992, Rolling Stone and Spin hailed Can You Fly as a masterpiece. Robert Christgau called it "a perfect album." Its success led to a major label deal with Elektra, for whom Johnston released "This Perfect World" in 1994. Not only did that album showcase Johnston's increasing sophistication and range as a songwriter, but it also included his breakthrough hit, "Bad Reputation." In an age where the Internet has greatly diminished the power of radio to dictate artistic success, Johnston is poised for perhaps the most exciting stage of his career. At this point, though, it isn't about destiny. Johnston fulfilled that a long time ago. Now, it's about joy - both for Johnston and his fans.

 

 

Jaymay has been described by the BBC as being the "darling of the New York 'Anti-Folk' scene", and by the New York Times as a "big name...for the indie universe". Jaymay appeared on the TV-show Late Night With Conan O'Brien and on The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson. She has collaborated with Kevin Devine on the songs "Brother's Blood", "Time to Burn" and "Murphy's Song", with Cheyenne on "Write It Down in Red", and with Dirty on Purpose on "Light Pollution, Like Bees". In 2010, it was announced she would provide guest vocals on art-metal band Goes Cube's second full-length studio album, In Tides And Drifts. She is also featured on the My Cousin, The Emperor songs "Burly, Old Couch" and "Somedays" from "The Subway EPs, Vol. I: Prospect Park West" released March 2011.

Jaymay official site | twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube

 

 

In 2005, Smith moved to Brooklyn and has since focused on writing fiction and performing as a songwriter/folk singer. His first EP "All the Cars My Friends Stole" was featured as a "New & Noteworthy" release on iTunes in Spring of 2010. Currently, he is working on a full length studio album with members of Wye Oak, Arbouretum & the Baltimore Afro-beat society.

Flanagan Smith official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

name: Panel of Experts
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Born out of necessity, Panel of Experts have been together since 2010, coming together to win their high school homecoming music competition. Drawing from the spirit of alt-rock legends like Muse, Foo Fighters, and Smashing Pumpkins, as well as the styles and sensibilities of indie groups like Mumford & Sons and Two Door Cinema Club, Panel of Experts play high-energy shows with driving riffs and catchy hooks. The band that began as The Seven Madmen quickly evolved into Panel of Experts in the summer of 2011, as they wrote original songs and pushed out a demo EP in the beginning of their senior year. After making their official debut as a band in September, they made their first appearance at Jammin' Java in November. Now they return for their first-ever headlining show. Panel of Experts are currently working on writing and gradually recording their first full-length release.

 

 

A Hero Poetic comes to party. 5 guys out of Reston, Virginia, AHP has come out swinging after their inception in the summer of 2011. After finishing a self-released EP over the summer, AHP quickly began working on building a local fan base through close fan to band connections and making it a policy to treat every fan with the appreciation that they deserve. A Hero Poetic's music comes with a unique blend of melodies and catchy hooks, and the guys have been working hard to make their live shows as much fun for fans as it for the boys onstage. Be on the lookout for their debut EP "Someday You'll Understand", now on iTunes, and keep watching the AHP Facebook for future shows and other news.

A Hero Poetic  facebook

 

The Duskwhales official site | myspace | facebook | youtube

name: Fight Cloud
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Fight Cloud is an Alternative Rock band from Sterling, VA consisting of six musicians from Potomac Falls High School. In the past two years, Fight Cloud has played at venues including Jammin' Java, Rock & Roll Hotel, and Jaxx, and has performed for many local and school events such as Relay For Life, and Loudoun Youthfest. The band recently signed with Rock X Records and is in the process of writing and recording their first studio album.

 

 

Sub-Radio Standard originated with Matt, John, and Evan messing around with covers and attempting original songs in Matt's basement in 2005. By the end of 2008 however, with the addition of drummer, Michael, the band began to concentrate on producing original lyrics and melodies. After auditioning several singers without luck, the band finally found Adam. The new dynamics of the group helped to jumpstart the band's productivity and Sub-Radio Standard was officially born. The band quickly began writing original songs as well as learning covers. Since 2009, they have successfully recorded a seven-song EP and have many more songs in the making. Sub-Radio Standard loves to perform at any venue and are eager to share their music with even larger audiences.

Sub-Radio Standard official site |  myspace | facebook

name: Ketura
body: Ketura is taking over the world with their unique mixture of modern electronic dance music and pop-heavy rock...and they're not going to be satisfied with Earth alone. Their newest singles - an electro cover of Toto's "Hold the Line" and the rapid-fire hard-style / rock hybrid "Breathe" are a testament to how far the band has come from their early days of strumming out Nirvana songs in the garage. Hailing from the east coast of the United States, Ketura's music crosses borders effortlessly, at once both cosmic and personable. Their songs deal with day-to-day life in a big way, giving dramatic expression to the thoughts, feelings and questions we all experience. Ketura's sound - both in the studio and live - is often described as "too big" to have come from two people. Drummer Bert Windsor and vocalist / synthist / guitarist Daniel Stapleton met when they were children. Their first conversation involved starting a band together, and they've been playing music ever since. Each brings a ferocity and attention to detail to the table that causes Ketura to stand out from the rest.

name: The Black Lillies
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.


The Black Lillies have created their own unique brand of country, roots, rock and blues via Appalachia. In April 2009, The Black Lillies released Whiskey Angel, their debut recording, which was recorded live in Cruz's living room. The album received rave reviews and appeared on multiple "Best of 2009″ lists across the country, winning the Independent Music Award for Best Album, Americana.

The band's current album, 100 Miles of Wreckage, has so far spent more than five months on the Americana radio Top 40 charts - four of them in the top 20 - once again proving that a band with this much spirit can break through traditional industry boundaries to achieve success without the constraints of a major label. The Black Lillies continue to tour non-stop, and without a doubt, they'll soon be appearing in a town near you. That's a relative term, of course, but trust us on this - they're worth the drive, however far it is, because you'll leave feeling like you've witnessed an old-fashion Southern tent revival. These songs will haunt your thoughts long after the curtain closes, rattling through your head like a crooked screen door slaps against its frame when a storm is coming.

name: Szefin
body: This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

name: The Herd of Main Street
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

The Herd of Main Street has been bringing their blend of American music to listeners both young and old throughout the Baltimore area. Call it soul, rock, country, blues, or just call it American, but the music of The Herd of Main Street is guaranteed to get hips a-shaking, feet a-tapping, heads a-bobbing, and hands a-clapping. Armed with countless influences and fierce determination, this five-piece band wants to grab the attention of every human body within ear shot of an amplifier.

 

"They stir together a rich mixture of Americana, blues, country, rock and possibly touches of other things deep and soulful to produce a collection of 10 songs that will take the listener on a journey far outside the grip of the cold, grey city. This is the music of wind-swept country plains and stretches of open road disappearing into a distant vanishing point." - Raysrealm blog

name: Merrifield Records Presents: An All Ages Afternoon Show
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Three kid-friendly, professional local bands leave the typical nightclub scene to play to younger audiences. With music ranging from loungey pop rock to high energy indie rock to guitar driven electronic; we are bringing sounds usually reserved for late night bars to a new venue. For music lovers of all ages we hope you can join us for an all ages afternoon.

 

 

Think Fast JAK is an indie rock hybrid band based around the powerful vocal talents of lead singer Jessica Sands and guitarist Anton Kozikowski. The band is breaking into the Washington, DC music scene with an energetic, stage act packed with Sands original cuts like "Screamer" and "Breath Free." TFJ is currently recording their first studio album and the band is creating a host of videos and media materials to support the release. The two harness healthy dose of sibling rivalry, keeping each other on task and adding a unique energy to their performances.

Think Fast JAK official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | youtube

 

 

The Dustys have finished recording their new album and need your help to master and press it! Check out their KICKSTARTER to make a donation to the cause.

The Dustys official site | twitter | myspace | facebook

 

 

Nikki and the Weeps is Nicole (sister), Michael (brother), Dex (brother's friend), and Kenny (brother's friend's brother). The members have known each other since they were respectively 10, 6, 6, and knee-high to a grasshopper. Influenced by music ranging from bossa nova to John Lennon to Patsy Cline the Weeps attempt to play........music.

Nikki and the Weeps official site | myspace | facebook

name: Elizaveta
body:
Early Show! This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

 

New York City born, Russian raised Elizaveta is about to take the world by storm with her debut EP set for release on Universal Republic on September, 27th. Her lead single 'Dreamer' which also drops on 9/27, serves as the perfect introduction to this classically trained pianist, opera singer and long time lover of pop music.

From Bach to Bjork and everything in-between, Elizaveta's world is created upon a fusion of opera, electronic beats, piano hooks and a pop melody. An ambitious endeavor it may seem, at which this multi-instrumentalist chanteuse and composer definitely succeeds, as she mixes up her very own heady brew of genres, echoing sensibilities not unlike those belonging to Queen's own (and former opera singer) Freddie Mercury.

Recently, the songstress just completed recording her debut album in the the studio with the reputable multi-Grammy award winner and producer Greg Wells [Adele, Rufus Wainwright, Katy Perry, Elton John] who helped Elizaveta hone in on her unique vision and style. The two began recording what will become her 2012 major label debut due January, 24th 2012.

 

 

 

Washington DC based singer-songwriter Tiffany Thompson's rich, clear voice brings to life her poetic and personal lyrics, reminding listeners of Colbie Caillat, Priscilla Ahn and Norah Jones. Playing both piano and guitar, Tiffany's dynamic stage presence and story telling style are gathering her fans of all ages. Her recent concerts credits include opening for the legendary folk-rock band America at The Birchmere in Virginia as well as Mindy Smith at Jammin Java in Virginia. On her spring 2011 album, Tiffany created her 4th album as an acoustic, jazzy collection of colorful pieces that shimmer their way into one's view of life and love.
Tiffany Thompson official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

name: The Poly-Opto CD Release + Ditched by Kate
Cathy Fink & Marcy Marxer  ROCKIN_��_��_ THE UKE CD Release Concert
body:
This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

The following is the schedule for the evening - all times subject to change without notice:

4:00 - The new Lobby Bar opens for dinner/drinks
5:00 - Doors
6:00 - Cathy Fink & Marcy Marxer

 

 

Cathy Fink & Marcy Marxer official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | youtube

GRAMMY® Award winners Cathy Fink & Marcy Marxer explore the versatility of the ukulele as they travel through swing, blues, old time country, folk and original songs on their new CD Rockin' the Uke. From Django inspired solos to lush harmony singing, the duo's consummate musicianship is matched by their enthusiasm for what this little instrument can do.

"As close to flawless folk/bluegrass as it gets"- Billboard Magazine

"...spellbinding acoustic musicians, with a rare mastery of American roots styles." - The Boston Globe

"...two voices entwined into a serpentine double helix of fluid expression..."- Bluegrass Unlimited

name: Down with Webster + Irresponsible
body:
Hailing from Toronto, Down With Webster is a musical force, poised to be the next international breakout from a country that is quickly becoming a leading exporter of musical sensations (Arcade Fire, Bieber and Drake). DWW's music draws from its 6 members' disparate influences to create a hip-hop/rock (hip-rock) sound described as a modern day Sly & The Family Stone meets Beastie Boys.

DWW must be experienced live. The band's wildly energetic, spectacular performances and constant, deep online interaction and engagement with fans through social media and DIY content ignited a viral internet buzz and fanatical fan following, resulting in massive growth of its social media sites (Facebook fans have increased from 7000 to 358,000+ fans in 13 months, including 100,000 new Facebook fans during one 5-week tour of the US in late 2010), and sold-out tours, including 10,000 people at its Toronto headline show in Summer of 2010.  DWW's debut EP, Time To Win, vol. I, has gone Gold in Canada and produced three Platinum-selling hit singles (Your Man, Whoa Is Me, Rich Girl$), three #1 videos, and many millions of YouTube hits. Since its release via Universal Motown in late 2009, the band has toured relentlessly across North America, sharing stages with some of the biggest names in music today, including Drake, Arcade Fire, The Roots, 3Oh!3 and Black Eyed Peas.

name: Anybody Who's Anybody CD Release
body:
Late show! 

This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

 

The OK Corral originated as an acoustic duo, and Brett and Mike spent the summer writing 5 originals, and following a plethora of makeshift and legitimate shows, these 5 original songs later became an EP in January 2008. In July of 2008, The OK Corral's lineup was finalized with Brett Nickley on lead vocals and guitar, Mike Matthews on lead guitar and vocals, Scott Nickley ..board and vocals, and Michael Burbrink on the drums. The new lineup got off to a fast start selling out Jammin' Java in Vienna, VA in August of 2008. This was both their first show as a full band and their first sell-out performance. The OK Corral continues to build up a full head of steam in an effort to make their music heard. The band has gained some national attention as they have been featured as a band of the week in AbsolutePunk.net's self-promotion spotlight drawing comparisons with the likes of Manchester Orchestra, The Format, and Steven Kellogg and the Sixers.

The OK Corral   myspace | facebook

 

Alvin Tan  twitter | facebook  youtube

name: Jamily Productions Presents: Covered with Jam
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

JAMBAND FAN NIGHT

Covered with Jam with special guest Ron Holloway (The Warren Haynes Band, Gov't Mule, Little Feat, Susan Tedeschi Band, Dizzy Gillespie)

 

Covered with Jam ....is a music collective consisting of the finest Funk/Jazz/Jam/Blues/Rock/Improv musicians in the DC area ...brought together to perform their favorite tunes ...while covering them with the tastiest jams ya ever heard!!!  

 

The Rob Hornfeck Enterprise official site - Phat grooves combined with superb musicianship, with a major element of fun!

 

On The Bus - official site  - On the Bus is a kind East Coast Grateful Dead tribute band, known for it's faithful recreation of the music, vibe, and experience of a Dead show

 

The Billy Triplett Trio - official site -  Fresh Organic Original and Cover Folk Rock Bluegrass Jams

 

DJ Root Boi - True School Hip-Hop Funk and Reggae

name: Aer + OCD: Moosh & Twist
body: David von Mering and Carter Schultz of Wayland, MA create music that finds its roots in reggae, acoustic pop and indie rock, with smooth guitar riffs and a strong rap component. Aer has performed at schools such as Lehigh University, University of North Carolina, University of South Carolina, University of Vermont, Roger Williams University, DeSales University, Bates College, Syracuse University, The Studio at Webster Hall, Canal Room, as well as numerous venues down the east coast to Florida and throughout the midwest. Aer has sold out headline shows at Gramercy Theatre in New York City and The Middle East Downstairs in Boston. "The Reach", which was sponsored by popular college music blog Good Music All Day, has amassed over 50,000 downloads since its May 9th 2011 release. Their latest release, EP "What You Need," rose to the #1 album on the iTunes hip-hop charts, and also made it in the top ten on the iTunes overall album charts. Their iTunes single "Feel I Bring" made the front of the Reggae page when iTunes placed the song in their "New & Noteworthy" section and one of their latest singles, "Slow Down" was featured on prolific hip-hop blog 2dopeboyz. Aer has shared the stage with the likes of Mac Miller, Shwayze and Cisco Adler, Hoodie Allen, Ballyhoo! and Cris Cab. This summer Aer will be playing The Bamboozle Festival in Asbury Park NJ.

name: A Great Big Pile of Leaves
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

The following is the schedule for the evening - all times subject to change without notice:

6:30 - Doors
7:30 - 8:00 - The Baby Grand
8:15 - 8:45 - Young Statues
9:00 - 9:40 - Mansions
10:00 - A Great Big Pile of Leaves

 

 

Brooklyn-based trio, A Great Big Pile of Leaves got their start in 2007 when guitarist/singer Peter Weiland and drummer Tyler Soucy took time from their prior projects to start writing material of their own. The first six songs came together as the self-released EP The Fiery Works, which the duo put out as a free download on their Web site. As word spread online, the band's fanbase grew along with Weiland and Soucy's excitement to get back to recording. Continuing with the formula of self-producing, The Fiery Works II followed shortly afterward and was also released as a free download. Within the next year, the digital releases were downloaded over 12,000 times and the group prepared for a live setting with the addition of Tucker Yaro on bass. After playing several shows and writing a batch of new songs over the next few months, the newfound trio prepared themselves to record a full-length record Have You Seen My Prefrontal Cortex? The group has seen a rapidly growing fan base as well as praise on infuential sites such as absolutepunk.net where the record was reviewed with a 93% approval rating.

 

 

In the winter of 2010, a spontaneous trip to Athens, GA became the birth of New Jersey/Philadelphia indie-rock outfit Young Statues. The record first began to take shape at Chase Park Transduction Studios, where a series of songs were recorded between friends, songs that were initially never intended to be released.  These songs were transformed into the impressive debut record for a band comprised of longtime friends in the Philadelphia area music scene. Full of swelling guitars, intricate vocal melodies and introspective lyrics, "Young Statues" is evidence of a group of musicians who have honed their skills and made a record to be revered for its beauty, tact, and honesty.

Young Statues official site | twitter | facebook

 

Mansions official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

 

Lead singer Miguel is a 19 year-old self-taught singer/songwriter who plays heartfelt original music that has been touching and inspiring audiences since 2005. Now performing with a full band The Baby Grand is steadily growing a fan base throughout the DC and Baltimore area. They are currently recording their first full band EP which is set for release late summer 2011. The Baby Grand will be recently performed at the Maryland date of this summer's Van's Warped Tour.

The Baby Grand official site | myspace | facebook

name: Steve Weeks
body:
"...honest, well-crafted songs that appeal to kids, parents... And anyone who doesn't mind having a pleasant melody bouncing around in their head for a day or two. ...This is simple, elegant songwriting with a heavy dose of whimsy." - Kenny Curtis, Kids Place Live (Sirius XM Radio)

"...quirky and upbeat, weaving whimsical stories as the music moves through bluegrass, rock, folk-hop, and reggae." - New Jersey Family magazine

"...Steve Weeks is not only moving children close to tears, he's making them giggle and shout for more." - Stephanie Ives, The Gazette

"Steve's performance was witty, engaging for the kids and kept us singing all the way home. If his music were food, it would be pizza!" - Lori Lilly, Parent

A truly original voice on the Kindie music scene, Steve Weeks performs with both a boisterous sense of humor and a deep sense of purpose. Join Steve at Jammin Java on February 18 for an interactive family romp filled with music, humor and games as he performs such favorites as "Kiki Kangaroo", "Someday", and "Don't Nothing Work Around Here No More". Come prepared to laugh. Come prepared to sing ...and bring those dancing shoes!

name: Since Antarctica
body: Described as "a force of nature" by fans, Since Antarctica emerged on the D.C.-area alt-rock scene ready, willing, and able to rock your face off. Their high-energy shows rivet audiences with musically sophisticated original songs performed with passion, virtuosity, and fun.Shannon Woods commands audiences' attention with soulful, powerhouse vocals (no twee whispering here) and a captivating on-stage presence. Mutton-chopped guitarist Walt Rieker slings driving, metal-tinged riffs with the assured swagger and charisma of a true rock star. Frantzie -- the man needs but one name -- brings an irresistible bassline as well as complex, emotionally raw songwriting and vocal harmonies. And drummer Chip Burden backs it all up with solid, frenetic beats to help ensure that each and every face present is thoroughly rocked off.

name: The Highballers
body:
Late show!

This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

The Highballers have been spinning heads since 2006 in the Northeast with buttery sweet harmonies that meld perfectly with the twang of Fender Telecasters. Guitarist Sean Lally's years of stage and studio experience is clear when he's playing his blazing leads. Besides being a driving force in the band's sound, the vintage guitar aficionado has a collection of nearly 30 guitars. Drake Sorey is a highly sought after drummer for good reason. His strong, steady and creative drumming carries the group. Los Angeles native, bassist Mike Barrientos, who spent a decade playing in punk bands, is the most recent addition to The Highballers, and his playing has brought a jolt to the band.

 

 

The Resistance emerged in early 2009 with musical influences ranging from Death Cab for Cutie, Coldplay, U2 and Radiohead. This indie-rock powerhouse is comprised of four seasoned musicians from the local scene bringing together a different, yet powerful mix of musical styles and genres. The Resistance has built a loyal following that has describes them as an indie band that incorporates a wide-range of styles into their music... simple, yet refined guitars with melodic undertones and a warm texture, high energy driving beats to ballad songs with a sprinkle of indie rock riffs, compassionate vocals with a soft voice but an occasional loud declaration of presence and a solid low end bass guitar that gives a rich depth to the overall sound.

The Resistance official site | twitter | myspace | facebook

 

 

The WeatherVanes are a folk 'n' roll band based out of Alexandria, VA. Their influences include; Tom Petty, Ryan Adams, Josh Ritter, and Ryan Bingham. Their music is a great mix of folk, blues, rock, and pop. They bring great energy to the stage, and will leave you wanting more.

The WeatherVanes official site | twitter | myspace | facebook

name: Shinobi Ninja
body: Shinobi Ninja is a Brooklyn-based party rock circus with an explosive live show. The band's music mashes up the sounds of 311, The Beastie Boys, Sublime, and Rage Against the Machine. This year, Shinobi has completed two back-to-back national tours, including notable performances at Summerfest, The Warped Tour, 311's Pow Wow Festival and Nerdapalooza. The official video for their new single "Rock Hood" was featured on MTVU.com and the track was be included in the video game NBA 2K12 debut October 2nd. Their groundbreaking iPhone video game app and debut album are for sale in the iTunes Store, and their new mixtape is available for free download on www.ShinobiNinja.com. After two years of of making a living together at Progressive Studios and The Sound Machine, this group of eclectic musicians decided to combine influences and form Shinobi Ninja in March 2008.

name: The Fielding Mellish
body: This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

name: An Evening with Paul Kelly
body:
This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

TWO-NIGHT PASS - SOLD OUT

VIP SEATING!! (Limited to 20) - March 11 & March 12 - VIP SOLD OUT
-No need to worry about lines or arriving hours early!
-Dedicated wait staff for food and beverage
-You get guaranteed seats

 

Special two-night A to Z show. Paul will be performing songs from his catalogue in alphabetical order over two special evenings.

 

Paul Kelly official site | myspace | itunes | youtube

In North America, Paul Kelly is loved by a fervent following of devoted, discerning listeners. In his native Australia, though, where his songs are lodged deeply in the country's soundtrack, Kelly is virtually a national hero. In a career that spans more than 30 years, Kelly has released a steady stream of albums that showcase his emotionally vivid, musically expansive songwriting, capturing the essence of the Australian landscape while demonstrating Kelly's uncanny ability to distill a novel's worth of narrative and character detail into a straightforward, effortlessly accessible melodic pop tune.

In the years since the release of his 1981 debut album Talk, Kelly has maintained a prolific pace that's helped to win him a permanent place in the hearts of fans around the world. He traveled extensively around Australia during his youth before settling in Melbourne, where he quickly established himself as a force in that city's diverse musical community. Gossip became Kelly's first U.S. release on A&M Records, which also issued his Under the Sun and So Much Water So Close to Home. Those albums won him reams of stateside critical acclaim, while expanding his loyal U.S. fan base.

Kelly has won also won numerous awards, including eight Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) Music Awards, and was induced into that organization's Hall of Fame in 1997. In spanning his entire recording career, Songs From the South (Volumes 1 & 2) demonstrates that Paul Kelly's recent output has remained as adventurous and compelling as the early work that first established him as a major artist. His songs remain as fresh and inspired as ever.

name: Gabe Dixon
body:
This show will be seated on a first come, first served basis.

 

Huffington Post named Gabe Dixon's One Spark album amongst the "Best Music Of 2011," Record Collector says Dixon is "a fresh new voice in the power-pop firmament," and legendary artist Jackson Browne writes "it's been a while since I've heard something so original." Dixon's 2009 self-titled band album was hailed as one of the "Best Of The Year" by Paste, American Songwriter, Performing Songwriter and in the year-end Village Voice critics poll. On the new album, Dixon's voice & piano still frame his critically acclaimed songs, but do so in the fuller more immediate company of two guitars, drums and bass. The album features co-writes with two Grammy Award winning writers and a duet with the most awarded female artist in Grammy history - Alison Krauss. Dixon's songs have been featured in numerous TV shows and films, including his song "Find My Way" as the main title theme for the #1 Sandra Bullock film "The Proposal." Dixon is also recognized as the "go to" pianist of choice, having handled keyboard duties for artists as varied as Paul McCartney, Supertramp, and Alison Krauss.

 

 

Lelia Broussard was hand-picked as one of the best unsigned artists in 2011 by the editors of Rolling Stone Magazine and Atlantic Records. The soulful indie/pop songstress recently performed at the Bonnaroo Music Festival as well as live on "Late Night With Jimmy Fallon." In her young career, Broussard has already collaborated with A-List producers including Glen Ballard (Alanis Morissette, Katy Perry), Rob Fusari (Lady Gaga, Whitney Houston, Destiny's Child), Espionage (Beyonce, Train, Chris Brown) and Dave Trumfio (Wilco, My Morning Jacket, Built To Spill). Lelia's songs have been featured on hit television shows such as MTV's The Hills, CBS' Joan of Arcadia, NBC's Men in Trees, as well as several independent films.

Lelia Broussard official site | twitter | myspace | facebook | itunes | youtube

 

 

Singer/songwriter Kayte Grace's music is an explosion of folk, blues, pop and rock, held together by warm-voiced, sing-along-able melodies and rich, resonant lyrics. The Washington Post called Kayte a "talented musician" who "writes great pop songs with smart lyrics and a country feel" and declared the "Written On" album (featuring Kayte's 5 time Grammy Award winning cousin Victor Wooten) an "impressive debut."

Only two years after first picking up a guitar, Kayte Grace has been featured not only by The Washington Post, but also by YouTube, The Augusta Chronicle, NBC and ABC in Georgia, Columbia Spectator, Ivy League Christian Observer and Washingtonian Magazine. She has more than 600,000 views on her YouTube videos, has released 3 albums, launched a 130 station college radio campaign, performed at NYC venues like The Bitter End and Sidewalk Café, went on a seven-city tour of the South (2009), performed during SXSW at Red Gorilla Music Fest (Austin, Tx) and released a full album (Written On) in May 2010. Most recently, Kayte organized, booked and self-promoted a 20 city, 22 show cross country tour (2010) promoting "Written On". Her songs have been featured in two independent films. A Screen Actors Guild member, Kayte has acted professionally for over fifteen years, landing roles in national commercials and in television shows like Law & Order: SVU, HBO's The Wire, and Gossip Girl.

Kayte Grace  official site | twitter | facebook | itunes | youtube
